intro: Cacalia rhombifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific coast of North America. It is characterized by its rhombic (diamond-shaped) leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae, which includes other bellflowers. Cacalia rhombifolia is often found in California and Oregon, where it thrives in cool, temperate climates.
